name: Fleaflicker Dark
description:
Check out the original style at userstyles.org
tired of blinding yourself while adjusting your lineups, adding & dropping players, watching the scoreboard during your matchups or otherwise using the popular fantasy sports site fleaflicker.com? well, i surely was... so i created this dark style which i've been using since around the start of the 2013 nfl season & figured i'd finally go ahead & share it. in addition to the delightful dark theme, this style includes a much larger scoreboard. long after i first created this style, Fleaflicker added a Dark Theme option to their Account Settings menu in case you weren't aware, but there are some things about it i don't like very much & maybe you're here because you feel the same way. i still much prefer my own darker style with larger scoreboard & i hope that you will as well. enjoy! :D keywords: fleaflicker flea flicker fleaflicker.com www.fleaflicker.com fantasy football nfl baseball mlb basketball nba hockey nhl celeb celebrity
additional_info:
2016.06.22: darkened default buttons, various other fixes, updated screenshot, added note3

2014.04.03: minor adjustments
2014.04.01: minor edits, updates due to site changes
2014.03.18: minor fixes
2014.03.01: updated notes
2013.11.06: adjusted "muted" text color 
2013.10.27: minor fix to player page stats box
2013.10.16: updated description & notes
2013.10.10: uploaded style & screenshot, created description & notes
2013.09.01: style originally created for personal use

*** note: the screenshot was taken with the Adblock Pro extension enabled in my browser, so your screen may differ slightly

*** note2: this has been tested with the nfl & mlb fantasy sections of the site. if you happen to notice any issues with other areas, please pm me the url of your league/team or post in the Feedback section below & i will gladly attempt to make any necessary corrections to the style

*** note3: this style works best with widescreen monitors. if you still use a 4:3 monitor & notice a logo covering up the scoreboard, try editing the style code by de-commenting the end (remove the */ from or near the last line & the /* from the 4th line above that) or by reducing the scoreboard size (decrease the font-size value near the end of line 39 or 41)
